content: Some clarification may help. You mention copying 'the whole thunderbird folder.' Was that just the exe, or did it include the profile? Where was the profile stored? On the default drive c in the appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder? I ask that because when thunderbird starts, it immediately attempts to open the profiles.ini (text file) in the appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder to retrieve the name and location of the default profile. If thunderbird is stating it can't find the profile, what that means is that it either can't find the profiles.ini file or the folder being pointed to has been moved. If thunderbird is finding the profiles.ini, it's easy to edit the file to point to the desired profile. These comments of mine may not 'solve' your issue, but I hope they help you investigate your issue.
creator: davidsk

content:
I don't know about the problem with not sending messages.

The problem with duplicate sent messages is usually solved by changing one's settings in Account Settings - Copies & Folders. Some servers save sent messages automatically, so one does not have to tell Thunderbird to save a copy. Uncheck saving sent messages in Thunderbird, send yourself a test message, and see how many copies are stored.
creator: mozilla98

content:
What server settings are you using for the Outgoing Server SMTP ?

Apparently the webpage - https://www.optus.com.au/support/answer?id=1434 says to use Outgoing SMTP

  • DEscription - suggest you enter full email address
  • Server name: mail.optusnet.com.au
  • Port: 25
  • Connection Security: STARTTLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password
  • Username : Your email address/username should always be entered in full (eg: username@optusnet.com.au)

Password - same password you use to access webmail account via a browser.

Useful info: https://www.optus.com.au/for-you/support/answer?id=20316

It does mention that non authenticated emails has a restriction of 1 per day. So make sure it's all set up as correctly authenticated.
creator: Toad-Hall

Pravdepodobne ste si vytvorili NOVÝ PROFIL Thunderbirdu. Odporúčam vrátiť sa k pôvodnému (asi Default) profilu. Na zobrazenie všetkých uložených profilov Thundrbirdu použite odkaz v ponuke Štart - Spustiť (alebo iba WIN+R) a tu vypíšte: "thunderbird -p" - bez úvodzoviek a prepnite sa do iného (pôvodného) profilu. Ak problém nepominie, tak sa môžete vrátiť k súčasnému profilu tiež príkazom "thunderbird -p http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/08/20/Thunderbird_novy_profil.jpg

Ak je problém odstránený, potom môžete ten nefunkčný profil odstrániť.

content:
Ste tu správne. Je to oficiálne diskusné fórum Thunderbirdu.

Každý emailový server má svoje pravidlá pre odosielanie hromadnej pošty. Preverte si tieto pravidla u správcu firemnej siete. Ručné odosielanie hromadných e-mailov môže viesť k problémom s doručiteľnosťou a k označeniu ako spam. Pokiaľ nie sú emaily správne podpísané a odosielané, server ich môže automaticky označiť za spam. Je celkom možné, že všetky tieto emaily skončili v SPAM koši.

content:
Do you have a Pop account in Thunderbird?

Thunderbird Pop accounts can only download whatever is in the server Inbox. If the server Spam filter puts anything in the server Spam' folder then you will not see those emails in Thunderbird because they do not exist in server Inbox. Please do this to check: Logon to webmail account via a browser and find out if those emails are being selected as 'Spam' by the server. You may need to tell server that those emails are from a safe sender to stop server putting them in Spam. Move emails into the Inbox, then in Thunderbird click on 'Get Messages' to download them.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
It may prove helpful to document what addressbooks you have. For example, you have a Thunderbird addressbook on your PC that is updated when you rightclick on emails to add them. If you have set Thunderbird to collect addresss for those to whom you send email, that will be an additional addressbook, and you mentioned that you have a gmail addressbook. Are there others? Each addressbook appears in the addressbook pane on the left side.

Now, the addressbooks on your PC (the default Thunderbird one, plus the collected address one) do NOT sync - and they are NOT accessible from your phone. They are updated only when you add or remove entries. The gmail addressbook is sync'd from your setting. (Cllick the three dots to the right of the addressbook and the synchronize option appears). The gmail account view within Thunderbird reflects whatever changes you make to that addressbook. You may find that many of your duplicates appear because there is an entry in the gmail addressbook and also in the Thunderbird one.
creator: davidsk

If you used 'Edit > Find > Search Messages Then you could enable the 'Location' column header to tell you folder name

If you used the Global Search then the left pane may tell you the folder But if you choose to 'show results as list' the you can enable the 'Location' column header to display folder name.

If you clicked on the email to open it in a new tab - you guessed it ...enable the 'Location' column header to display folder name.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
I strongly recommend NOT using the EXPORT feature as it repeatedly causes problems. Instead, I recommend this way, which has proved successful for many users:

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk
